reviewText:
So let's start with the actual game, because that's what you're all here for right?


First impressions are a HUGE thing, especially when you want to keep players playing and encourage other players to start playing. My first 30 minutes of this game were absolutely horrendous. I spent majority of the time running over the terrible looking map and constantly being annoyed by the same grass/flowers textures that would wave into existence 5m from my character. I managed to find several places to loot, finding small amounts of food and water and a LARGE abundance of items that are obviously meant for crafting. Here's the downside to having all those items; before you can properly use most of them, you first need to find blueprints in order to craft even the most basic of items. Want to build a campfire? Gotta find that blueprint first. They don't appear easy to find either- I looted an entire city and did not find a single blueprint of any kind. So 90% of the other items I  found were useless to me.

Sprinting requires no stamina, yet jumping takes it away which ultimately makes no sense. Both sprinting and jumping should decrease stamina. The zombies are a joke, with them doing so very little in the world. I stood 3m away from one without it aggroing and when it finally did aggro, it stutter-stepped everywhere and quickly de-aggroed when I started running away.

The lack of wildlife in a map that houses the perfect environment to house even birds, is quite annoying, given that animals would still be present at the time of this game.

The game itself offers no instructions in regards to things like group-making, crafting and a myriad of other important tasks. I had to do a manual search on the forums to find out how to group with someone, which turns out that you have to enter in a /" command into chat in order to do so- a very annoying task.

Overall
date: I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone but if you're looking to at least try it out
recommended: go for it. It's free to play
hoursPlayed:
but that doesn't mean it is exempt from being so horrible.

column47: let me explain it to you. Every tree is considered an object within the game

Please educate yourself Artemis."

reviewText:
It's the WarZ debacle all over again...these devs just seem to hate players
== THE REVIEW ==
I really wanted to give the guys who gave us WarZ another chance. But they are doing the same thing here as they did with WarZ, both with the game and in how they treat their community (in the forums - mass forum bans, critical posts deleted).

This game is WarZ's brother, it has only a few changes.

Category	Summary        GRAPHICS:        The graphics have potential, but the lack of opimization right now makes it a challenge to get the same results as shown on the store page.  If you turn the settings to Ultra and have all the settings enabled (such as SSAO and AA), you'll get the same or similar results as shown in the store slider. You're fps will most likely drop to 10-15 when in the middle of a city or town if you are like most people, and many people claim they get around 30-50 ordinarily (when not in the thick of it), which seems reasonable and is what I get as well depending upon the area I'm in at the time.

I had previously been extremely critical about the graphics and shared 2 screenshots here that were taken with what I thought, Ultra settings. I was mistaken, they weren't. So I've removed those screen shots and amended this review accordingly.

I apologize to the devs and those who read my review for that mistaken criticism.

In summary, the graphics in the game can be quote good, but it seems that an awful lot of optimization has yet to occur for them to be consistently realized. It's in beta, so optimization is to be expected as the game develops.	MELEE:	Pretty bad. You can stand there in front of a zombie and allow it to hit you. You take no damage. I did this over and over again with about 20 zombies to test it...even taking on 3 at a time. The only time I took damage is when I had my back turned.	LOOT: 	There is a variety of loot to gather, but very small amount of storage space. Some items do stack, and some items can be broken down. But most of this is meaningless w/o a method to store it all and your first backpacks will be insufficient.	BUILDINGS: 	Quality wise, the buildings are on par with WarZ. There is very little diversity with home architecture and styling.  City buildings such as police departments, office buildings,  garages, post offices, etc. are identical to those found in WarZ. There are towers and silos with ladders, but you can't climb them (ladders don't work).	GUNS: 	Gotta have them right? Some guns are found in the world, some guns can be bought in the in-game store (with real money).  You can also buy blueprints (with real money) for guns which will help give you an edge over other players. You can also buy chests which will have tier 1 guns and ammo.  	ZOMBIES:	Ahh, the most important part of a zombie game, no? Well, not in Aftermath unfortunately. Zombies just stand out in the open, still...just waiting for aggro. They do not roam, they will only move when you come into range. They aren't much of a surprise or threat.

They are super easy to kill because they do no damage. about 5 hits to the head with the average weapon (which does 20-25 dmg) and they go down. They have the identical look, sound, and behavior as WarZ. The one difference that I can think of however, is that the WarZ zeds did damage to you, and some roamed, and there were hordes. Not the case in Aftermath. Very uninspiring.          STABILITY:         The game is in open beta so it is expected that there will be stability and framerate issues. But right now at this stage, it can be a chore trying to not crash when logging in or trying to get consistent fps.  Many users are complaining about the game locking up on them and having to manually restart their computers. I have experienced this 4x so far when joining a server. There's a thread now about it in the forum. Some play 10-15 mins before locking up, some lock up at launch, some lock up when joining a server.

It should be noted however, that since yesterday, I have not experienced any hangups. I don't know if this issue has been resolved, if so, I'll update this review accordingly in a few days.

Low framerate seems to be an issue most players are experiencing. The game clearly is not optimized yet. Even those with monster rigs that can handle most fully released, modern game are reporting they are having issues.  I run the game on ULTRA at about 10-20fps when near buildings and zombies. In the open, the fps is much better (40-50fps). But you can't stay in the open for long. You need to find buildings, people, zeds, etc.

There is a lot of work to do in this area.	SUMMARY:	 This game is nearly identical to WarZ with only a few changes. How much those changes set this game apart from WarZ, remains to be seen. The dev behavior and attitude towards the players, at least during the first 24 hrs of its Steam release,  has been the same as was seen in WarZ. So if you like being treated like dirt and/or want your non-violation criticism to be deleted and get banned from it...you will love these devs!
Because I felt that there just had to be some differences between the games, yet didn't see any nor could I find any explained outside the game, I decided to get help from the community. Surely the devs wouldn't just copy/paste" WarZ into a new name would they? That's absurd. No...there has to be some differences...

Trying to find out the differences...
I actually created a thread asking for the differences. In the op I asked that no one flame the game or devs or even Warz. A nice poster responded and pointed out some of the differences.

The devs did not like that...at all. They don't want this game to be compared or contrasted to their previous mess and scam WarZ...at all.  They deleted the thread.

I had heard that the devs were deleting threads and banning posters like crazy just like they did in their forums. I didn't believe at the time because I'd not seen it myself (only participating in a few threads here).  But sure enough
date: the claim became a reality.\n\nIf you have any experience with WarZ and were expecting...or even hoping...for a different experience and were nice enough to offer a second chance to the devs (like I was)
recommended:
don't. You are going to experience exactly more of the same.

Bad devs usually produce bad products. This is no exception.

//// end original review

Update
== BANNED FROM FORUM ==

Wow...talk about making it easy to prove my case...the devs did it rather quickly.

I posted in a thread where people were bashing
hoursPlayed: out right bashing the devs and WarZ with very nasty things. Instead of following suit
voteText:
I responded with a well thought out post with my experiences and my personal opinions as a result of the devs being on a ban and thread delete rampage (just like they did on their own forums with WarZ).

The non-violation post
This is the post (and dev reasoning) that got me banned:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=525102063

Yup...that's it. While critical of the dev's behavior and the game itself
helpfulPercent: no obscenities or personal attacks...absolutely nothing that violates Steam's Forum Policies.\n\nSo what was the justification? Well
votesHelpful: here is the dev's response who banned me from the forum for creating such a "horrible" and "violating" post:\n\nOriginally posted by You were banned by a Aftermath developer:Reason: "take a break
votesTotal: come back when you're not so entitled. "\nThank you devs for supporting the veracity of my criticism."

reviewText:
Romero's AftermathRomero's Aftermath is an open world survival horror action game similar to other games such as DayZ, H1Z1, & Miscreated.   The game offers both player vs player (PvP) as well as player vs environment (PvE) in first and third-person views.  This is a survival game so expect to scavenge the large world map for resources while crafting items such as weapons, gear, and defensive structures.

History RepeatsThe game was announced as being developed to both succeed and to make amends for the abysimal title Infestation: Servial Stories (ISS) formally known as WarZ.  The business model for WarZ/ISS was perhaps the worst I have seen in gaming whereby one had to play and level up multiple players to counter the real $$$ transactions to respawn or be forced to log out for awhile to wait for a respawn timer.

WarZ/ISS was without a doubt a pay-to-win (PTW) whereby one could buy and bank weapons to later respawn fully geared as wallet commandos to lay waste to players with limited funds. Later updates made changes to this system but the publisher limited these changes to maximize profits.  Another troubling issue was very poor support to fight hackers.  These changes failed to meet consumer expectations and ultimately the game was a complet failure. We (gamers) were told the publisher refussed to further invest in ISS and forbid further developemnet which led to the developement of Aftermath.

The AftermathAftermath is not WarZ or ISS but it did not fall far from the tree. As you will see from my review there are some good elements to this game that could make it shine but unfortunately the bad tend to cast a very dark shadow.

The GoodControl: Typical first/third-person shooter very similar to H1Z1 and Miscreated.

Environment:  The map is huge with lots of camps and towns to explore and scavenge.  Towns get over run and there is a meter to see what percent of zombies have been destroyed. There are also safe zones where you can buy supplies, ammo, and weapons.  You can also bank/unbank items on PvP servers in safezones.

Graphics: The graphics fall in between ISS and H1Z1.  This is no AAA title and as such will be a downgrade in graphics from DayZ and H1Z1. But this is a FTP indie developed game so graphics are what would be expected, good but not great.

Framerate: The game plays smooth at least on my high end gaming system.  For an early access (EA) game and my frame rate is much better than DayZ and about the same as H1Z1 with an average frame rate in the high 60's with lows in the 50's and highs as much as 100 fps with every setting maxed out.

Good & BadCombat: The combat system is both good and bad.  The good is that hits require one to aim for head shots (HS) or you will have to hit players/zombies 20 times before they die which is a nice feature although 20 hits seems like overkill. The bad is that you can hit a zombie or player in melee from 10 feet away.

Zombie AI: I like that you can line of sight (LoS) zombies so that when you are low health you do not have to run for miles to lose them. Zombies afterall have very low intelligence with the one basic need to feed.  The bad is that currently you can stand on a something like a crate and kill hordes of zombies without taking damage. Hit response from the AI is better than other survival games, but that isn't saying much considering most survival games' combat systems combined with fps drops and lag make them horrible.  But at least in this game, you will not take hits while the zombie is facing the other dirrection like you do in the other survival horror games mentioned above.

Survival Challenge:  I liked the fact that you become infected which you must treat or die.  Of course it would be awesome to become a playable zombie, but that is wishful thinking.  However infection has little to no warning and sadly seems to be the only survival facter outside of zombies and other players.  There are no harsh weather conditions that I can tell.

Crafting System: You can craft just about everything from meals to a fortified base. You must find/learn patterns to craft items, even basic things like a bandage or building a fire which can be problematic to survival.  In five hours of gameplay I found seven patterns and none of them were needed for basic survival.  You do gain health back from eating food but it is at a very slow rate.  Discovery is a much better system for crafting although this one would not be so bad if basic things like a fire and bandages were known at the start. I should mention that once you learn to craft something you will always know it.

The BadEconomy:  The rate at which you find or earn money by selling items is horrible.  I think I found $30 in-game-currency (igc) in my first three hoursof gameplay.  There where over 100 people on my server so it could have all been looted prior to me getting to locations, but I expect this to be the norm.  After about five hours of game play and selling an unwanted item (not needed for crafting) I had close to $300 igc, still not enough to buy a bottle of water at $430 igc.  Now if the zombies were lootable, and perhaps they are meant to be and are just bugged or will be later, it would be much easier to get money. But after learning more about the business model of this game, I doubt it.

The UglyBusiness Model:  The business model at first glance seems like a great improvement with the only items one can purchase with real $$$ is permanent skins.  Rare skins are bought through crates similar to Counter-Strike and H1Z1 while more common skins can be purchased by both real $$$ and ingame currency.

After playing for awhile you figure out there is a real $$$ conversion system that enables wallet commandos to buy weapons and supplies. You may think that isn't so bad but when you look at the over inflated prices of a bottle of water selling for $430 igc and weapons as much as $3,000 igc you begin to wonder why after 5 hours of game play and selling items I still didn't have enough igc to buy a bottle of water.

There is a purpose behind these inflated prices, this business model forces you to buy and convert money to buy items so the developers can make money off of little to no innovative concepts. Rather than making money off of cool game features, the developers intend to line their pockets by charging real money for the bare essentials needed to play this game competitively in PvP. Off course you can farm the items if you intend to farm for 8-12 hours a day prior to joining PvP so you are stocked up on weapons, ammo, and medkits.

Although this business model doesn't do mush to break a PvE game, in PvP being able to convert money quickly to buy weapons, ammo, and supplies over having to earn them in game can be game breaking for those that enter with limited supplies.

Pros-Decent Graphics (not AAA)
-Control
-Free-to-play

Cons-Money accrual is punishing
-Crafting patterns
-EA bugs/crashes
-Business Model is PTW by design for PvP (little to no affect on PvE servers).

RecommendationI wanted to believe the developers and support this game but the business model is deceptively a PTW to line the developer's pockets.  Until which time changes are made to either stop converting real $$$ for IGC or weapons are no longer sold, I cannot recommend Aftermath as much as I wanted to.

If you like survival games and do not already own H1Z1, Miscreated, or DayZ and only want to play on a PvE server then give it a try as it is FTP and BM does not affect PvE.  However, if you want to play competitive PvP, stay far away unless you plan on spending money over and over again for a competitive advantage.  There are plenty of other games in this genre to play that offer balanced gameplay without the PTW BM.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=527631789

reviewText:
So here's an example of the cash-grab scheme this developer is marketing. Today, I got to my first in-game store inside of a safezone. I can sell a compass I managed to scavenge for $13. To buy the same compass from the store costs $1540. A bottle of water costs hundreds of dollars. Generally, any piece of junk you can find in the world is costing thousands of in-game dollars; but after nearly 10 hours of gameplay you will only manage to find about $30-40. Prepare to fork out over $10,000 for the rights to buy a gun.... and what you have is Romero's Aftermath.

If you don't pay into the game, don't expect to get equipment.

If you're free-to-play, your incentive is to go play on a PVP servers to 'gank' some poor sap's equipment b/c there is simply no other way to do it. Similarly, expect little cooperation from other people when their first inclination is to murder you in PVP for whatever you're carrying in the hopes of finding that 'nice thing' you might have.

The attack animations are garbage, and choopy. Zombies appear to take damage between swings, at random unconnected intervals. I've seen better animations in Morrowind (think 1990's game graphics- those graphics beat this game's graphics). It's a humiliating display of developer inneptitude.

Environments can't be interacted with, not a single door or window can be closed. Items lay about, upon the ground, or sometimes floating in the air. I find the lack of environment interaction alarmingly simplistic. The graphics are complete garbage to be honest, the textures equally garbage.

The market economy, though is the deal-breaker for me. I can't even enjoy the game for what it's worth if all my actions are ultimately worthless according to the jacked-up prices. As free-to-play, I would be destined to be a cold-blooded murderer if I ever wanted gear worth having and that's not my playstyle.

I gladly uninstalled this game with no regrets. I only regret the few hours of my life I can't get back.

reviewText:
Romero's Aftermath. Are we lead to believe that it was approved by George A. Romero, the master of horror cinema? When I saw the title, kind of. No, instead it's actually from his son, George C. Romero.

I wasn't even aware he had a son, a quick search online pulls up almost absolutely nothing that would lead me to believe George C. Romero would be competent in game development, besides the fact he plays video games and that doesn't make a good developer or even a writer.

Then I saw the pinned title, describing how there are not only people who worked on The War-Z but also Infestation Survivor Stories, but that the engine running those horrible lackluster titles was infact licensed for this game.

So we got someone, using their father's good name to attract attention, using a engine for some of the worst games on steam. At what point should anyone who has kept track of the stupid drama surrounding these games have ANY interest at all this this title?

Yeah, sure, it's free to play. Big deal. The folks behind previous titles shouldn't even be WANTED on STEAM anymore. Romero Jr. is a horrible hack selling his family name to utter garbage like this, and trying to earn a living off his father's reputation. What a sad day.

reviewText:
Let me tell you of my experience on Romero's Aftermath. TL;DR

I went into this game with a thought of hopefullness that maybe.. just maybe they finally did one of their games right despite all of the negative reviews already. After my game finished downloading I launched the game and registered, then it crashed. I didn't think nothing of it and tried launching the game again, only to find out it wouldn't let me because the game was still apparently running.. when it clearly wasn't. So after a good five or so minute wait, it finally let me back on the game. I spawned in and immediatley crashed again. After crashing I had to wait another five or so minutes and then finally it let me back on. I spawned in this time without crashing only to find one of the most horrible looking games I have every played. It is clunky and the looting system is nothing to write home about. I set all that aside and decided to try to make the best of it. I ran into the nearest town, found a gun with no ammo (even though it said I had ammo, it wouldn't let me shoot) and ran into two guys. I had aquired a bar of soap while looting before meeting these two gentlemen and decided to try to make friends with them. I told them that if they could spare me some supplies, I could give them a good time and drop this fine bar of soap I had just found. They yelled some spanish words at me and started beating me. I ran away to try to evade these guys and another random fellow also yelling spanish words at me joined the chase. I ran for a good solid minute until the unthinkable happened............. I crashed. Getting a black screen but still able to hear what was happening in the game, I listened helplessly while these 3 banditos beat me to death with shanks.

TL;DR Don't bother with this game. Through some form of witch craft they managed to make an even worse game compared to WarZ or ISS despite this game still being in beta. If you download it you will only be disappointed by many crashes, a poorly executed game, and random bandits with shanks that kos.

Oh and one last thing I forgot to mention... MICROTRANSACTIONS!

reviewText: There's potential here, but it needs a lot, and I do mean A LOT of polish. The combat system especially; as long as you're roughly facing a zombie from anywhere from a foot to seemingly 10 feet away, just swing your fists or melee weapon and you'll be sure to hit them. However, whether they'll go down in three hits or thirty is a complete mystery. Standard survival game stuff otherwise -- search for items, craft helpful objects, explore, etc. -- but a real low budget version of your typical survival game. There's a long road ahead if they want this game to be anything but forgettable. I'll check back in a year or so.

Unfortunately I didn't read the reviews before getting this game. I simply saw Free To Play and though eh why not... I played for maybe about 45 mins and decided not to proceed anymore for the reasons below.

The game is boring. Simple as that.

The zombies off 0 challenge.

There is nothing to really collect or rather should I say nothing worth while to collect. There were about 50 cars where I spawned in at. The cars had the exact same loot. I started with a 24 pack and had it full within 2 mins of playing the game. I tend to do this on most games so it didnt really seem like a big deal until I continued looking for items. They were all the same. You could easily disassemble them into crafting ♥♥♥♥ but HOW? I mean you take broken glass right clikc and not its glass pieces. You take Drain X and right click now magicall you have chemicals and plastic... There is no sense in making a craft game if you dont have reasonable reasons to the crafting mechanics lol.

I couldn't create an ax without the blue print. Then I would need tool, wood, parts, and a tool box... WHAT! i searched for 30 mins to find 2 parts and i would need 2 more of those and then the rest of this ♥♥♥♥ just to make and axe.... Mind you I would need the axe to get wood as well. In most game it is a little dumb to attack a tree to get wood but it makes more sense than tell the user, well we arent going to stock your spawn with anything even resembling something useful in the game."

And that was when i found a better weapon that my hands or the knife i was given off the start lol. It did more damage but honestly was ♥♥♥♥ compaired to just punching a zombie to death and never being touched by the zombie."

reviewText:
Here is my quick review, u can find my detailed review below.
I really love survival games, but I won't play this game.
Everything else > Pain > Hit by a truck > Agony > This > WarZ/InfestationPros:
U can find potatos in the world. HOW cool is that?
I found a banana in the trash. HOW awesome is that?
I haven't found any game-breaking p2w elements... yet.
Servers with 120 slots.
Artworks looks stunning.Cons:
Same as WarZ/Infestation.
Bad graphics/optimisation combo.
Bad game mechanics (7 stabs with a hunting knife to kill a zombie, really?)
Poor level design.
U can't enter some buildings.
[/td]    [/table]            Gameplay        This is my first priority. I don't care about the graphics, if the gameplay is great. Well, it's not so bad, but the worst in the zombi survival genre.
- First of all, your character is an unskillful, clumsy, noob individual.
- Hard to find a proper melee weapon. If you lucky enough to find a hunting knife, well... that won't change anything. You still need 7-9 punch to a zombie to kill him. 9 if the zombie leans and your character miss the punch. You can reduce that to 5 punch in first person. Dear Devs, Even Hershel Greene could stick a knife into a zombie's head. Why my dummy character can't do that?- Most of the stuff just useless materials, specially in the beginning when u don't have recipes to build stuffs.
- You have to find recipes, there is a similar idea in Miscreated, but you can't buy them for REAL money in that game. You can here.
- Have I said your character is dumb? He can't even make a campfire without recipe. OR a nailed baseball bat. He don't deserve to live in this situation. He is not zombi-post apocalyptic proof.
- You won't be able to find guns in 1.5 hour. Actually that's not so bad, just irritating.
- Backpacks, backpacks eveywhere.
WarZ/Infestation?        Is it WarZ/Infestation with a different name?
Basically, yes.
- Zombies are the same. They used the models/sounds from WarZ. They should have made new zombies for this game.
- The UI is new, but works in a similar way. Actually, WarZ/Infestation's UI was better, and looked cooler.             It's a f2p game, let's see the P2W elements.        - Most of the items are cosmetics, u can't buy guns if I'm right. But u can buy recipes for crafting... in a basebulding game. I can imagine how hard is to find recipes for your base.
- You could rent servers in WarZ with passwords, so you could loot your server for gear, and kill everyone in other public servers. There are no rentable servers in this game, but you can buy legendary account. If you have legendary account you can join legendary servers. Idk what is that, and what you get for your money, but if they set the loot spawn rate higher on legendary servers, and they let you to join with that gear to casual servers, that would be p2w. I hope they won't do it.                Graphics/Optimisation        Graphics looks bad. Some people say, because your PC is not enough for this beauty". Well... just look at Arma3
date: i thought that game has the worst optimisation. I am able to run arma on high with 45+ fps (stable 60 fps in better mods) and that game is a beauty. Just look at it. I can run this game in DX9 High-Med with terrible fps. And the game just looks bad. The textures
recommended:
the props would be great for a game in 2005. I think the optimisation won't be better. They recommend i7 and gtx 970 for this game. There are way prettier games with better optimisation and lower requirments. Like Miscreated (that game uses CryEngine guys!)
Even H1Z1 looks way better.
- Bamburg and other citys: 20-35
- Forests: ~ 30 fps
- Deserts: 45-60 fps        Level Desing        There is an old Mayan saying: get a good level designer
hoursPlayed: and your game is already great. Actually

helpfulPercent: but a good level designer can give a great atmosphere for games. Specially for zombie or other post apocalyptic games. I'm sorry
votesHelpful: but I have to say
votesTotal: the level design is just poor."

reviewText:
https://youtu.be/8CBPYSH10cg
Game: Romero's Aftermath
Genre: MMORPG Zombie Survival Horror
Developer: Free Reign Entertainment
Publisher: Free Reign Entertainment
Copy supplied by Steam

Romero's Aftermath is a MMORPG zombie survival horror game developed and published by Free Reign Entertainment, the same creators of the infamous WarZ (a.k.a. Infestation: Survivor Stories).

GRAPHICSI wouldn't be surprised if most of the assets came directly from WarZ: the models are unpolished, the animations wonky, the cities and towns bland and the forests boring. The performance is also very bad, and I hardly ever got 60fps even at the lowest settings and resolution.

GAMEPLAYIf you have played any other game of this genre, you know what you're getting: an open world with both zombies and human players, item and resource scavenging, crafting and overall survival. What this game does best is creating a huge map with many locations, a small amount of firearms and good food and water meters. But the rest is done terribly.
The combat is broken, with even the worst melee weapon stunning a zombie instantly, and the crafting is nonsensical. Also going from one part of the map to the other is extremely boring, and an auto-run button is really needed, with some journeys taking even 20 minutes.
Thankfully, the community is pretty great, and I've never been killed by another player that I encountered. But that isn't enough for saving a gameplay that is mostly unchanged from WarZ, and with even worse micro-transactions.

CHALLENGEThe good aspect of this game is that your water and food meter will deplete very slowly, unlike other games in the genre. The bad aspect is that the zombies are way too easy to overpower, and you will probably die because you fell from somewhere or you went AFK for a couple of seconds.

SOUNDFor some reason, the zombie sounds are inconsistent and repetitive, if they even play at all: once I was surrounded by the most quiet zombie horde I've ever seen. The sound effects are also very weak and the main menu music is basically nonexistent.

REPLAYABILITYThe best aspect of the game: you will spend a lot of time playing this game and trying to survive, but only if you are a fan of the genre, otherwise there is nothing special about it to make you come back.

Overall, even though the game is F2P, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone especially because you have to create another account and you might also have problems connecting to a server. Even as a fan of the genre, I was disappointed by the developers, who are also shutting down negative criticism and made some players pay 50$ to buy a F2P game.

Story: n/a
Graphics: 3
Gameplay: 4
Challenge: 5
Sound: 2
Replayability: 6

ENJOYMENT: 3.5
FRUSTRATION: 7

reviewText:
I'll give my honest opinion/ review on this game. First off, I played PvE, which makes this game have potential. Good amount of zombies to kill, crafting is there, building is there, so it's like a mix of L4D meets Rust.  But this game has much to work on, animations for one, the Zombies walk as if they are in a strobe light. You can easily kill a zombie 1 on 1 with fists or a knife just by croutching.

Now this is really where the game gets really bad, You can enter forts or bases that are clearly military ( nothing but military zombies and fortifications inside ) but yet not find a single gun, or even ammo. Also Zombies don't carry a single thing, how is that possible? Oh wait one out of 2000 did a giant create that I have to pay to open!

Which now makes me put 2 and 2 together, can't find guns, but Zombies drop gun creates that need to be paid for to open.

This right here is what is ruining the game, it uses the worst P2P model ever, it's just wrong, they should have only made you pay for cosmetic items, people would buy it if they want it. I mean lets say you find heavy armor, you could pay for a cosmetic mod that makes that armor look like space marine armor, not to mention gun cosmetic mods, gun skins, hat colors/ skins, shirt colors/ skins, list goes on.

It's sad that it seems to be a trend between Russian/ ukraineian devs to just favor a faction with no actual balance  or true to life data ( WarThunder ) Promising things that never come ( Survarium ) or straight up ripping off their supporters.

So, with that I would refrain from paying a dime, i would even say don't play this, but that's your choice.

Also a message to the dev's/ Your supporters/ customers make or break you, without us you're nothing, start listening to what we have to say.

reviewText:
Oh boy... here we go again. I'm going to review this game as neutral as I possibly can, but I will be touching on some very strong opinions because of my past with this dev team. So be prepared for that. If you want to know what I think of the game in a I can't read that much" fashion... skip to my final verdict at the end. Also note that although my time here is only 1.5 hours (on Steam) I have played this game out of Steam prior to its release here.


Overview
"Romero's Aftermath" is developed and self published by a spin off group named Free Reign Entertainment. I say spin off because the majority of the dev team came from War Z/Infestation Survivor Stories. Some of them were existing devs from the start
date: some joined further into the War Z project
hoursPlayed: some are obviously new. The "lead" or head of all of this is none other than Sergey Titov. You will remember his stellar leadership paving the way for War Z which is arguably the single most controversial title to EVER hit PC Gaming.\n\nThat said... this is an open world
voteText: survival horror game. There is rumor that George Romero has approved of the use of his name in the title... but I wouldn't count on that lasting after he learns about this game and the dev team. Most people turn and run as fast as they can when getting involved in this group. That all said
helpfulPercent:
I will try and be as neutral as I can be for the sake of the review.


Graphics
I reference graphics early on because a significant portion of gamers wont touch a game unless it's top tier standard in the graphics department. Well then look no further. If you're one of those types
votesHelpful: don't bother downloading this game. The textures are extremely sub-par. I'm not entirely sure if this engine is to blame or the lack of dev experience... but they are exactly the same as War Z was which is a 3 year old game. Nothing has changed. I don't understand why the devs can't improve on something which was poor the first time around. Anyway
votesTotal:
don't expect to be blown away by anything here.


Storyline
Now most survival games have almost no storyline. But plenty of open world games do. So while this game is both
votesFunny: it has no story at all. Don't expect anything in terms of questing
column17: or anything else that would add weight to the game. It is kill
column18: or be killed. You can do a bit of base building
column19:
but ultimately you need to go out there and gather supplies to survive.


Side Questing
There is a sort of side quest system in place that allows you to complete "objectives" in a town like getting a generator fixed
column20: that will give you a reward. But
column21: don't expect to profit much from this
column22:
and certainly don't expect much in the way of depth to the "side quests".


Combat
The meat and potatoes of this game is the combat. The majority of what you'll be dealing with
column23: is combat. Whether that be killing AI zombies
column24: or other players if you choose the PvP server... you will need to fight at some point. The store page talks about being a trader and such... but that would be near impossible without a little bit of fighting first.\n\nThe mechanics of combat is pretty terrible and clunky. The animations make it hard to really fight well. It's pull sniper duty
column25:
or spray. You can try some low level tactics with other players... flanking and the like. But the engine and how the game plays leaves little room to really enjoy the combat. It's mindless killing.

The Zombie AI in the game is horrendous and makes combat with them impossible. You just swing or shoot and at some point the AI dies. Coupled with the terrible performance (see below)... don't expect much in the way of ENJOYABLE combat.


Skills
column26:
and Upgrades
Weapons can be "upgraded" (attachments) and you can get skins for them. A LOT of skins in fact. If this is something that interests you (like Counterstrike players) then you might actually like that aspect of the game. The player too can be "upgraded" with various skins (all sorts of clothing items from hats to masks to shirts to pants). So if having a slightly unique appearance (not a long of ways to change your face and body)... then you'll have fun grinding for cash or paying for the in-game "premium" currency (GD)  to get the items.


Game Performance
I run a PC with the following specs:

AMD FX-8370 (8 core CPU) @ 4.01ghz
G.Skill RAM 16GB @ 1600mhz
Asus GTX 960 2GB
Windows 10

The MOST frames I pulled with the game nearly maxed out... 15. The average frames I pulled looking out to nothing was around 10 or so. Which even for a beta
column27: is absolute trash. I was so frustrated with this latest version of the game when attacking a zombie at 8 fps
column28:
that I had to stop playing. I would have at least given it another 30 minutes or so... just couldn't do it.

There's also a LOT of pop in with graphics. Especially player gardens that seem to pop up within 50m or so. It was surprising and annoying. I was not at ALL impressed with how this game ran.

I talked about clunky animations and due to the shart performance
column31: and impossible to combat. I had to struggle at 8fps to run circles around the AI just hoping that between slideshows
column32:
that I was hitting something.


Final Verdict
The history of this dev team is going to weigh down on how their game is received and probably the future of it. Don't expect this game to set standards and raise any bars at all. With it's ridiculous fps problems (which is sub-par for most dev teams)
column33: poor animations and lacking combat... this isn't a game most people will enjoy.\n\nThere are some interesting features (skins and such) that some people might like. But it doesn't balance out the issues the game has. Even if it is in a beta state
column34: this game is severely struggling and will continue to struggle.\n\nThe only thing going for it
column35: is it's free. But there are some pay to win features that ruin that for most people. While you can't buy guns and ammo with real life cash like in War Z
column36:
you can buy blueprints. That's a HUGE advantage vs a player who spends nothing. Which plays heavily on multiplayer.

In the end... do I think this is a game you should get? No. If you want to play something for free with absolutely no intentions on committing to it... try it. But it's not worth it if you ask me.


Post Review Update
I just thought I would let everyone know that as of this morning I was banned from the Aftermath forums. This is the second time the War Z devs have banned me from a forum because I have openly criticized their game. This ban is for one month (which is pretty extreme for the Steam forums) because I disagreed with a player who stated that this dev team is the best and so is the game.

I have to wonder if the devs aren't going around voting down critical reviews of the game while banning people that otherwise might speak out against the problems its facing just to keep the public opinion positive. Pretty disappointing that this group of people haven't changed a single bit. I certainly wont give this game another chance and certainly wont be trying anything else this dev team puts out in the future."

reviewText:
So i've been reading alot of these reviews saying how bad the game is while in all honesty the game isn't that bad at all, ok the game has a few bugs, but as far as i know every game i played had bugs, People talk alot about that the game crashes, i've been playing roughly 100hours now and my game crashed 2 times, My csgo crashes more often than Aftermath does

And it might not have the best graphics but honestly it doesnt really bother me, Character models are Good and Visible. Rocks and houses look decent enough altough some could use some work, The only thing i could agree on about this is that trees are freaking weird they just dont look right but really in the end, im paying more attention to players running somewhere near it than actually looking at the trees so in all summed up it really doesnt bother me at all

People who are saying that there are so many cheaters must only play for -15 hours as they would be on novice and you will meet more cheaters there, once you can go in Veteran i literally have not met a single hacker, Anti-cheat seems to be doing an OK job could always be better ofcourse but no anti-cheat is perfect every game has and always will have some hacker in it no mather what you do,

on the matter of it being a Pay2Win game i totally disagree with everyone who says this, before i put money in the game i already had more than enough off everything, i just wanted more And lets be honest everyone likes more :P But what im trying to say is the game can be perfectly played without ever spending money on it, The blueprints you can buy are all findable in the world, it might take you a bit but they are there, and if you cant find one you could always trade for it with another player, the only thing i dont like to much is the limited GI i mean i filled my 100spots within a week filled with bullets, backpacks Lvl4 and up, scars, Mx-tac's, shotguns, M9's so the only real reason to spend money on this game is to upgrade your GI, Case keys can be found randomly on the map, or by killing zombies, and so far i already found 6-7, Big stash chest's and Trick or treat chest's can also be found on the map so if you say its Pay2Win i'll just say You got bad aim son!

-Pro's;
-Quick and easy switchable person view (1st and 3rd)
-Easy to use base building
-Liberating (a very nice concept)
-Crafting system wich makes you adventure ( if you really want to make those Fruit smoothie's better go look for a plan :D )
-Free2Play!
-Easy playable with friends, with party's of up to 10 people
-15-20 hours of novice wich will help you stack up a few items before throwing you in the big boy Pit (and if you really dont wanna wait all that time just stay in the safezone for a bit while you go do something else, stack up those hours boy! )
-Oh and did i say Free2Play?

Cons:
-If you have to run from one corner on the map to the other say North east to South west you better make sure you have a book to read as it will take you quite some time ( should easily be fixed once cars get added back in to the game)
-takes some time to get used to the shooting mechanism with the bullet drop and max effective range and all that, but when you play for a while you will get used to it very quickly
-the fact that in the chat window there is a Clan" tab but has litterally no use is a bit sad (but will surely be added later in the game)
-Graphics (wich could be a turn off for some but really im fine with it)

This is my very first zombie survival game so i dont really have anything to compare to or dont know anything about the ♥♥♥♥ that happened with Warz/infestation but in my eyes this is a very fun game
date: first time i really got into a zombie survival game
recommended: the game is more about the Battles with other players than it really is about surviving wich i am really happy about
hoursPlayed: ofcourse there is room for improvement as there is for every game

reviewText:
Just horrible, I paid 15 bucks to pre order War Z, and was instantly regretting it. I'm glad this monstrosity is free otherwise I would of asked for a refund.

Besides it being War Z revamped but with 10x more glitches its just another zombie survival aimed at making a quick buck nothing new everything is tied down to a plan/blueprint to craft that you can just buy with real money and craft gear right off the bat, the same goes for food.

One thing that surprised me a bit was their blatant attempt at the Valves case system, except instead of keys they use usb sticks its pretty hilarious. Although I will admit besides being able to obtain blueprints with real money you can also obtain them in game with enough patience.. you will need patience, a lot of it. I swung my knife and my audio corrupted in game making it pretty much unplayable, followed by a crash that left the game frozen on my screen making me reset my computer.

This is just another cash grab, but if you can't afford H1Z1 this will probably give you the zombie survival fix you're looking for if you dropped this low in the zombie survival list.

So after many comments on this telling me that it is indeed, not George A. Romero, the master of zombies whose name is on this, but his ♥♥♥♥♥♥ son, George C. Romero, I've edited my review.

Flatly, this game is awful. There's no easy way around it.

The sound doesn't work half the time, by this I mean that when you swing your fists, expect a sound to play about every 10th swing. That's just one of MANY sound bugs.

The graphics are absolutely awful. As many other reviews and a quick Google search will show you, they're mostly just copy pasta from their last game, which was also a massive flop.

If you're like me, you want to ignore this review and download anyways. Don't. Just don't. I did and it was a massive waste of time and it barely took 15 minutes to download and install. I still regret that loss of time.

Only postive thing about this game, it uninstalls.

reviewText:
So picture DayZ, H1Z1 and any other copy of these games and then take a big old poop on it and finally proceed to ignite it all with as much napalm you can get your grimy little hands on.

The graphics are very poor, animations are just pathetic and zombies pose little challenge when you can walk around them holding left click.

Items spawn too often, making crafting a simple joke where you have 60+ of every resource. Most items are just random things like Drabo, Tide, Rope that has no meaning other than to break it down into base crafting ingredients, leaving you with little interactive fun.

Weapons are too common, in my two hour stroll through 2 cities I found 4 guns, tons of ammo and too many melee weapons to count. Everyone is armed to the teeth, if you know whats good for you, stay inside a house, barricade it up and just grind the insanely fast repawn of items.

Also tons of bugs that seem they should of been fixed long ago, like not being able to use their slow website to reset a password you know you have correct (lmao I had just played, wrote it down, tried typing it in 10 times with error, this is funny)

Personal Rating: 1/5

reviewText:
I,ve been keeping a wary eye on the war Z / Infestation : Survivor stories back then.
It felt like a Pay to test" Alpha game with rather shady practices.

Now you get Aftermath... which litterally feels like a Free to play version of Infestation ... with the same zombie animations
recommended:
same general look.

But... i still logged about 2 hours in (on a PVE server) and i might log some more as a brainless grind fest. I was lucky enough not to die yet (so no idea if they kept the X Hours death timer) but so far it's strangely average

- The world feels very empty
- The Crafting System is very hard to get in (need to find the Plans beforehand and plan spawns are random)
- The combat seems to basically be : Do 100 damage to a Zombie's head ( thus 5 hits with a 20 damage weapon)
- Graphics are subpar
- The "grind" feeling : Stuff costs an AWFUL lot. I managed to find 16 $ (in game money) ... whereas some items costs as much as 40000 $ for non combat items (like pants and shirts ... such as seen on one of the screen caps)
- The "pay to win" feel : You can actually Buy Gold Coins with Real Life Money ... That you can Trade in For In game Money. So there is a way to actually buy gear In Game via the cash shop. So i don
hoursPlayed: t feel like it
voteText:
s honest to say the cash shop Only serves for skins.
- Many bugs

Would I recommend the game to my friends ? Not Really
Would i give it a shot and see if the devs actually work on the game to make it better ? Sure

But for now ? it's mostly a free to play timesink to scratch that "zombie game" itch"

reviewText: Another game from the Big Rigs dev team... a F2P with a TON of recycled assets from their previous failure, Infestation: Survivor Stories (Also known as TheWarZ). I played this in beta (because I sadly bought I:SS when it came out and they gave a code to ex-players) and I will say that the game was polished since, but only the gameplay. Romero's Aftermath is very similar to Infestation: Survivor Stories by it's graphics and the incredibly bad sound effects aswell as the overall boring gameplay.\n\nI do not recommend this game or any game made by Sergey Titov and his team, who have given up on making good games a long time ago. They release half-♥♥♥♥♥ games and only cash in on the genre of their game (Open World). Infestation: Survivor Stories was released in the wake of the DayZ mod's popularity and they cashed in on the fact that the market was empty, as DayZ:Standalone had yet to be released. Now they're pulling the same deal but with H1Z1's *supposedly* future F2P model, as that market has yet again no competition.

reviewText: Right... Lets start this off... My PC exceeds game requirements,load this game and graphics are terrible on ultra with 5 fps? This is extremely annoying as i can run this game on max.... Load it on low for a better experience and guess what? Fps doesnt even go above 12... Extremely annoying! Now i dont like playing survival games with loads of players as they are annoying and kill me often. The only good and well maintained servers have over 100 players constantly when i would really just like 10-20... I think there should be dedicated servers for a max of 20 players for those of us that want to play the game without dying every time you go near a city/base. This game has stolen skin ideas from CSGO and i dont like that at all, if you want a game with skins then make up your own ideas please. This game's crafting mechanic is annoying and a pain to figure out. It is easier to contemplate the theory of relativity then find crafting items on this game and i dont like that however if this is changed it must not be too easy to find these things... This game has potential and i am hoping to see more but currently its a 3/10

reviewText:
Just to let you know these devs never managed to fix many of the game breaking problems in Warz after 3 yrs and I highly doubt this game will be any different. Just research Big Rigs, War inc, Warz, Rise of the Badlands and most recently Burstfire your soon see what this company/devs are all about.

They never fixed random server disconnects, game freezes, failed to join server issues, game crashes, public game servers could be down for anything from 1-5 days but also private servers and no refund was offered for your lost server time or even an apology, hackers (Encouraged these with everything they did or didn't do), the glitchy zombies, glitches in the map like walls that you could walk in and out of resulting in people hiding in them and waiting for people to walk by to shoot, the amount of car bugs they had in the game that would kill you was beyond funny whoever designed/implemented the cars should of been fired he obviously has no ability, they made the game more unstable as the months went on, they downgraded the server host which led to laggy servers yet increased private server prices, added graphic patches that mean't alot of the players could no longer play the game completely destroyer peoples fps, loot getting stuck in trees or walls etc, having your gun go through a wall or fence etc that could be shot, gun not firing in third person mode when too close to a wall, zooming in with your gun or binos would make your camera fly up in the air, reloading glitches, removing servers without telling anyone and people would lose their lockers and loot inside of them, removing private servers that people had paid for without saying anything or offering a refund, the game was completely pay to win unless you had a decent sized clan to run around with and kill for gear from the poor suckers that brought gear pretty as much all the best gear didn't spawn in the world or very rare, banning innocents, their total lack of professionalism on the forums to their fan base, lies and false advertising over and over, the total lack of communication with the player base, their useless customer suport that was always copy and paste responses and basically not giving a F*ck.

They are a disgusting company and shouldn't be allowed to operate in the gaming industry but unfortunately they are so all I can do is say play this game for free but please, please... don't spend any money on it.

reviewText:
Allow me to take the time to tell you the story of when I played ‘Aftermath’… For a whole eight minutes.

I began by perusing the games store page (looking at the pretty pictures basically). I generally avoid looking at reviews before playing a game to avoid being influenced to feel a certain way before forming my own opinion of the game itself, although I kind of wish I’d read the ‘mixed’ reviews of this game…

Nevertheless, before I stray too far from the topic at hand – My experience playing this game.

My eight minutes of playtime went as follows:
•	2 Minutes spent making an account to access the auxiliary downloads
•	1 Minute spent performing auxiliary downloads to access the game
•	1 Minute spent selecting a server from a ‘wide variety’ of servers
•	3 Minutes playing
•	(1 minute total loading screens ETC)

I spawned into a heavily detailed… Sorry, sparse, low poly and lazily textured landscape, with what I’m presuming was meant to be a derelict street with rusted cars parked along either side with various spoils hidden inside them (the usual; empty bottles, bandages ETC)

As most new-spawn players do, I grabbed everything I could out of lack of knowledge as to how complicated any crafting in-game is… Better to be safe than sorry… The loot spawns were fairly normal as I stated above, just bandaged, water bottles and fairly useless junk. However, as I approached the brow of the hill, a sedan was parked horizontally across the street, and what was in the car, I was astounded to see, amazed, in awe. Both at how amazing it was, and how bloody ludicrous is was.

It was a pineapple.

A FREAKING PINEAPPLE.

Oh and it was so huge that it was nearly clipping through the vehicle model.

Like, imagine a normal sedan, with a 4-foot high pineapple in the drivers seat.

I wanted it, it would be mine. My pineapple! AdhesivePineapple!

I reached out with a shaky, excited hand, and just as I was able to brush the spiky leafy things on the pineapple… I was shot by a player infinitely more equipped than myself. I Collapse to the floor, and frantically try to find the key to use my microphone to cuss the player into oblivion, and then he shot me again.

I quit the game.

SUMMARY:
•	SPENT 5 MINUTES DOING SETUP AND LOADING SCREENS
•	PLAYED FOR 3 MINUTES
•	GOT KILLED BY A PLAYER
•	DIDN’T EVER SEE A ZOMBIE
•	QUIT THE GAME
•	UNINSTALLED

10/10 The only aftermath I've experienced playing this gamewas the annoyance of spending my valuable hard drive space on such utter twaddle.

reviewText:
So i played about a half hour or so, up to you if you wish to take any of this review seriously based on such a small amount of play time.

Moment I joined a server, my frame rate was down the gutter, and I was defaulted to low settings. Although I know diddly about high specs, coupled with the fact that I just got this gaming pc the other day, I found the low frame rate a little odd seeing as how I can play Skyrim on ultra with no problems. Then i figured that skyrim has no network aspects to it as you play...so I went and played Planetside 2 with no drops in frames. I dont think its my rig...

About 10 minutes in my frame rate stabilized. Things certainly got better after that, but I had a few stutterings that I am going to assume were network related on the game's end (as a note, havent had any stutterings on Planetside, Warface, Warframe, or Dirty Bomb). Less than 30 minutes in and the game doesnt seem all that great to me. Figured I would start off by doing the stabby stabs to zombie's heads to almost get laid out by one zombie with Commando lunges. I dont need to go through that again...

Oddly enough, seeing as how the sole purpose of my getting a gaming pc to begin with was for the performance consoles so sorely lack, none of the above completely turned me off from this game. The lack of any kind of this is how you do this"

reviewText:
I have to preface this with saying, I knew what I was getting in to when I started. I did not expect more from this game than it was.

And yes I know about the whole WarZ thing, and I have to say. Aftermath is a crappy beyond belief game even for being free. Yes if you have no money, its fine but for us that pay for games do not waste your time.

The game itself isnt inherently bad. It doesnt look terrible, I didn't encounter any bugs, and it was smooth. But even on max it looked like crap, the environment makes me feel like a pet lizard in a glass terrarium. The zombies aren't any good.

My intent with this game was to download and just ♥♥♥♥ around, but that I go no enjoyment out of.

I have never wanted  my time back more in my life than now.

reviewText:
One of the best games i played in about a year.

Throw away DayZ because romero's Aftermath is totally free to play and it doesnt feel like a pay2win at all.
If you pay it is mainly for cosmetic items and/or to show your support to the dev's.
The environment does not feel 'super' realistic but thats one of the aspects i actualy like about this game.
You can choose either to play PVE (for those who do not like being shot) or PVP (for those wo like a little risk).
i have only been able to experience one bug in 85 hours of gameplay (my screen minimizes around every two hours, no big deal). There's one other issue i have and thats the fact i can't launch the game anymore after 80 hours of gameplay unless i do a forced shutdown on my computer (press power button 10 seconds).
Whilst i'm waiting for a fix i would give this game a 9/10.

EDIT: There are people who complain about this game being a 'running simulator' i can tell you this is not true. You are able to reach key destinations in just a few minutes and if you are in a group (The grouping system is GREAT!) you can always group spawn on your friends. If you are one of those who do not have any friends i am sure you will make some ingame. And if you do not like pressing shift there's always the option to press Num Lock which makes you run without even having to touch your keyboard.

EDIT 2: The bug has fixed itself and my game launches properly again.

reviewText: So I only played for two hours. I am sure there was content that I didn't experience. All-in-all has the potential to be a great game but really should not have seen Steam without drastic overhaul. The first issue that ruined this for me was the sound. Yes, the sound. I would be looting in a house with my headphones on when suddenly I would hear a zombie sounding like they were having an ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Others sounded constipated. The god awful running around would keep the same noise regardless of terrain. Unless it was grass. So for the gameplay it wasn't too bad. It reminded me a lot like Rust and H1Z1. It has a neat crafting system except you have to find blue prints for the most basic items. It also requires you to spend a lot of time looting junk or break down into crafting supplies. Fix the crafting. The combat was dull. It took me 30 stabs with a butcher knife to kill ONE zombie. No thanks.\n\nNow, what I really liked in this game is respawning and the ability to have a map that shows location. After you die you can select a general area to respawn in. This saves 20 minutes running across a large ♥♥♥ map. The map location was refreshing and I hope future apoc sandbox games follow suit. Also, throw in some vehicles. I have no idea why in almost every apoc sandbox game cars magically go extinct and mechanics forget how to work on cars. I mean I can construct a complex explosive but not fix a car? Cmon. This game is far from being polished and maybe in a few months I'll come take a peak again.

reviewText:
This game is a piece of ♥♥♥♥, my reasons being are...

1) Guns are abundant and are waaayyy too easy to find and the ammo is usually situated right next to it thus taking out the struggle for survival as you can one tap absolutely anything.

2) The hit detection is less likely to hit than a parapellegic person walking. Literally i thought it was bad when i was first shooting at people and i put it down to my aim being off but i tested it with my friend and they were point blank shooting me in the head and missing.

3) The damage of some weapons are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, melee weapons and most pistols are able to one shot however military rifles take 10 shots plus and shotguns are pitiful even at close range!

4) There is no damage multiplier regardless on where you hit the body, i blatantly shot a player in the head and he turned and one tapped me with his pistol -_-

5) The cheaters - Nuff said

Overall this game is a steaming pile of ♥♥♥♥ that was wrenched by the sewers by some bum who is unlucky enough that he literally has to eat feces while he slowly dies of cholera which is the ♥♥♥♥ of which is this games graphics reside.

reviewText: The key bindings are done so poorly that I uninstalled the game after having played for only a minute.  WASD is a terrible default scheme that became popular with half-life 17 years ago.  The first thing I learned about FPS was to move over to ESDF.  But fine, every developer wants to go with this ilthought and never rethought default key binding scheme from 1998, but you have got to let us rebind our keys.  Now, at least Aftermath let's you rebind them in the first place *ahem H1Z1*, but the fact that I can't bind a key that's already bound is an on it's face absurdly bad interface choice.\n\nThere continue to be no good open world zombie survival games.

reviewText:
Please know, this is not pay to win.
This is what war z/ infestation should had been like. The buildings actually have objects in the homes, offices, post offices, and etc. The ground has color adding flowers, bushes, better tress, and etc. New guns and a lot of crafting items. I really wanted to enjoy this game, but i found it hard for myself just to keep playing the game.

Pros
Nice map size with a lot of details in it
mini stores in the cities where you can purchase items
New items
entering a town, their are side missions in the town a lot with fixing generators and clearing the town. Also tells you the name of the town you are entering on the side
Crafting is a lot more useful
Safe zones

cons
zombie glitches- they can hit you from 3 yards away
ambient sounds go on and off
Zombies can hit you through walls
If you spawn in city you have no spawn protection
You make loud walking sounds even when crouching

reviewText:
Played for 2 1/2 hours,...killed 25 zombies... walked 2 hours 14 minutes. Died 4 times...BY THIRST.

Some of the items Seem exciting. Unless you have an idea of what to do with them, you spend time gathering things that LOOK good. But you have no clue as to what they may or may not make.
I'd rather spend time staring at the walls, Than go through the hell on earth of walking for 2 hours and dying 4 times from it. From Thirst.
When I DID get somewhere, some complex or other... I DIED OF THRIST AS I ENTERED THE AREA!!!!
Nice to know that players get to experience a Zombie AFTERMATH.  The only aftermath I found while playing was death by thirst... And Walking / Die by Thrist. Walking / Die by Thirst.
Walking.
Die.
By.
Thrist.
No Thanks.! I'm good.

reviewText:
Garbage. Utter garbage. Anyone remember that game, WarZ? Yeah, that horrible scam of a game? This was made by the same creators. You know how much this game is? Frees you say? Nope! not a while ago, they sold it for CASH. REAL LIFE MONEY. They sold it for money, then they made it free. First off, selling it for money is a scam (because its more broken than DayZ's first dev build running 70 mods) and making it free is even more of a scam! I even feel scammed for getting this game as a F2P. Here are the basics of this game.

Performance
Ok, you can't play a game if it runs like garbage...


It runs like garbage. The graphics are crap, so, why does it run like garbage?
There was no explanation for why they suck.

Graphics
They look like an indie game from 2009 on low settings. When my settings are on high!
Grass pops up 5 feet in front of you. Not much else I can say.

Gameplay
It's dull, you can't find anything, It's like DayZ but way worse.

Community
They are all KOS. The PVE servers are full of griefers who follow you and destroy everything you make.

Devs/Admins
Alright guys, go post my review in the discussions! OH WAIT! DON'T! YOU'LL GET BANNED!
Yep, you heard me right! You'll get banned if you say anything bad about this game. Reviews are fine though, they can't erase it.
0/10-IGN (too much gameplay)

reviewText:
Best thing about this game was the Uninstall Function!

First off I saw the game and thought this looked Good. After 30 mintutes pf playing I still had no idea what to do. Everytime you die you are respawned somewhere else. When you quit the game and come back the next day, your on the other side of the map.

You can't travel fast to any place so you have to run, which in between cities is boring as there is nothing to do.

I eventually got a Level 4 backpack and a few usfull items, well would have been useful if I didn't need blueprints to make simple items. So I kept them for when I do find blueprints (which was very rare in my opinion)

In the city Luton"

reviewText:
Pros:

- Really nice looking game and sounds were okay I guess
- Looking at the amount of guns and weapons available looked good*
- Was pretty easy to just start and play, run around and collect/kill
- It's free

Cons:

- It's super boring. You just collect crap and then break it down to get more crap that you cannot use without finding the rarest thing in the world.
- Lots of flashy backpacks, guns, armour and there is ZERO chance of finding them. Want some cool stuff pay for it.
- Environment was really flat. It looks nice but there is no interaction (opening doors etc) and it breaks the game down a lot
- Animations lag behind a few seconds and same for footstep sounds. You swing your bat (cause you never find a gun) around and its like 3 seconds later you hit them.

The game has a nice protential to become something small, but it lacks so much. Weither it will get added in the long run, we will see. Uninstalled and good luck to anyone who continues to play it!

reviewText: First of all i have to say that this was my first try of a Zombie Survival Game. I liked the fact that this one has also a PvE Mode involved and is for free so i could just have a look at the genre.\nAfter installing the game and starting it first thing happened... it crashed because i don't had enough disk space left on my OS partition (i installed it on my gaming partition). Ok, after that i freed some diskspace and it worked. Still wanted to try this one out. So i started a new game. The graphics are not really good, but i wasn't expecting to much as it is free. I was starting in one of the save camps in the south. Forgot it's name but it doesn't matter. In the camps we're absolutly nothing to loot so don't bother to even try to find something. After leaving the camp i found myself in something that seems to be a desert. At least the buttom looked like it could be sand (i was playing with best graphical details). I ran arround a little and looted some of the small camps and killed some of the zombies nearby. You will just find Zombies near any POIs. Pretty quick i found out that the Zombies won't hit you if you are just standing in front of them holding the Mousebutton to hit them. So not much survival there. I came through 2 towns before i reached the main city in the middle (probably in 6-7 ours of play). I had found 3 weapons at that time. 2 of them needed munition i haven't found once during playtime. At least the Shotgun we're usefull. I also found some blueprints, but none for any weapons. Just a lot for building different vegetable patches. Which weren't really useful. But the worst thing of all we're the main city, which made me stop playing. From the distance you'll see a lot of big buildings which promises some nice loot. But when you reach it... A lot of the big buildings are just deco. You can't enter them! And when you found a stair or something to enter a apartment complex there are no arpartments to enter. One of the bigger buildings which you can enter had 5 floors (from outside it should have 30-40) with nothing in the rooms except some loot in the edges of the rooms laying on the ground. I recommend to spare you're free time playing something else. Maybe this game will be playable and fun in 1-2 years but now it isn't.

reviewText:
As a former warz-infestions player, i'd say that all that BIG HYPE , for no results .
Only that was added was base building, more crafting and bigger map.
As for guns, they're not bad but still could have put alittle more effort into this game.
Took them a year or two , just to make a sandbox game like disney infinty .
As a H1Z1 player as well, i'd recommend people just to buy that for 20 bucks and have 50x's more fun.
I can understand that this is still a early release but if the only thing different from this and infestions is the map, base building and crafting........... Its not worth the space or your time.
Also the loading game data" Sucks too. take anywhere from 30 seconds to 7 minutes.....
I'm sorry to say dev's

recommended: the pvp is ALOT MORE intense-ish.\nWhat i mean by that is that it makes you think more about engaging your enemy or friend(s) due to the lack of ammo and guns"

reviewText:
First off I have plenty of time logged on this game to give you a very good run down of this game.

Let me make this very clear for a free to play game this has a crazy amount of p2w elements in it. If needed you can drop 20-40 bucks to get decent gear, weapons and ammo to take on anyone in pvp and they have private servers that increase loot chance and rarity for people who subscribe to the game.

Combat is ♥♥♥♥ nothing outside of rifles should be used in most cases againist other people. The longevity of this game is ♥♥♥♥ poor if you log off more than 7 days your base which has more than 400 combined hours of effort is completely despawned with all items and resources completely gone.
They have cosmetic cases that actually drop in game which is terrible because they can spawn on top of other important items covering them up.

If you want to play this game beware of bugs and constant problems with keybinds and ♥♥♥♥ GUI interfaces.

This review doesn't even sum up the majority of the problems, please do not play this game.

reviewText:
So, i played this game a bit more than 1 hour and i gotta say, don't download this.
Besides the fact that this game is not that good optimized, (sometimes had lags which appeared for like 1 second or so, normally the FPS were around 150) it just didn't feel really comfortable to play it.
The controls are alright, i guess.
What I also don't like about this game is, that you can find crates, but shall buy keys with real money.
Okay sure, (almost) every freetoplay game has some sort of stuff you can only buy with real money.
But c'mon, weapons in crates? Seems a bit like Pay2Win. Also many of those skins look familiar to weapons/skins of CS:GO.

I played this game with a friend but somehow we couldn't find the names of each other and couldn't add us in the friendlist which was weird.

What I have seen so far:
-Bugs, I mean i jumped on a Table and got stuck in it. Really game? There was no way to get out of that and I lost all my stuff then.
-Graphics are alright
-The Zombies are not that smart. I felt like they didn't even really try to kill you because they just looked at you and let you kill them. (Which took a crazy amount of hits before they died!)

All in All I would say, don't download this. It doesn't make fun and I don't think it will ever do.

10/10 would deinstall again.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Close enough to the infestation survivor goodness, but not enough...


Pros:
That sweet sweet pvp... literally... i mean thats all, but its so addicting and rewarding getting the loot, or farming, getting stuff to base and go pvp...
The backpacks, comparing to ISS, carry way more stuff
The stamina system, cool now, you can walk around zigzaging and jumping
Open world
Free-to-play

Cons:
Remember how sweet i said it was to get stuff? well you have to drop it cause there is a global inventory cap at 100, yep, it aint unlimited now, i played for 10 hours and i reached the maximum GI capacity... so please, fix.
Hackers ofc, didnt see many, but have seen people one shot me while using full armor 3.5, and i know how hard that is... comparing to IS:S, has way less, or i dont have knowledge of the remaining yet
Talking about armors, you cant say a player has armor and which one, because there are no models when you are using one. So it can be a newb with no armor or a pro guy with high tech end armor and you wont be able to say which one is who.
Zombies kind of bugged.. but not much, just sometimes 360 you while attacking them which is not cool
Weapons durability, you should be able to repair them as many times as you which... or at least have no durability system at all
Weapon stash should be dropped on death.. you can just be a bambi on a pvp server waiting for a group of elite pvpers to save the city and than go fast take the stuff before they kill you... and you wont lose it its ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥


Dont go on and on about the buying stuff and pay to win... please dont, i now have 25 hours of aftermath and i have everything but a sniper, but with everything i mean everything, you just need to be open up to learning and learn the game. About zombies being too op.. wtf?? too op were on ISS when they added sprinters and super zombies, but these cool noob zombies... you can just run away as a bambi and you can farm a whole city... just have skill and awareness of whats surrounding you.

I cant remember of anything else, but get the GI CAP off and deal with hackers and it should be nice for everyone.

reviewText:
Like SIMPLE games ? This ones for you.. Very few types of guns in it. Ammo for half of them is rare. Most the guns are only worth breaking down to get parts and tools" <-- remember those words as we go.

Find other things in the world.. Which you can do nothing with... But break them down for more "parts and tools" o.O Seeming a pattern here....

Wait.. Something good... Liberate a city and get air drops :D :D To get the same worthless guns.. That you break down... For "parts.... and tools......"... Lots of knifes that do hardly no damage... Knifes are worthless.....

Outfits :D That has to be good right ?.. -.- Spend $30... End up getting the default items the game gave you in the start... Have to open chests for clothes.. -.- and it picks what you get... Spend another $30 :) Surely Ill get it this time... -.- More copies of things you already had....

Build a base :D Thats GOT to be good... -.- Forced to stick a statue in the CENTER of where you wanna build.... But its explained as you go. Very limited on the things you can build
date: -.- Few walls.. Only one box storage per claim -.- Cant sort your items out into different chests... (food
hoursPlayed: or crappy guns...)\n\nAh just go back to looting :) but.. then looting gets you nothing but parts and tools -.- and looting values are now dropped to basically nothing for PVE players... Even PVP players hardly get nothing.. They are trying to force you to buy their legendary pack
voteText: which is worthless
helpfulPercent:
and gets you nothing but "PARTS and TOOLS" slightly faster...

The whole game... Is all about parts and tools... and how much money they can trick you into spending for worthless junk...

So about the "PARTS AND TOOLS!" There must be a reason for so many right ? Build your base walls.. Build your shack in the middle of those walls since you cant build actual custom bases. Run out of the very limited things your able to build... and just keep saving those "parts and tools" Its all the game has for you to do in it.

But MAYBE if the devs that did a live broadcast for a map they never let out after promising it for a month
votesHelpful: spent time working on the game instead of on CS:GO as he was on the broadcast for this game... Then the game might actually have some content other than "parts.... and tools....""
