reviewText: Now the that I have 400+hours on my playtime, I think I'm qualified to make a review about the game.\n\nI disregarded other people's negative review in Steam and downloaded it because it's Free to Play." Guess what
date:
They were right!

During my playtime there were times chat log will be flooded with angry people saying bad things about the game and I was one of the players who defended the game against them. Only to get ♥♥♥♥ed by the developers of the game!

Don't get me wrong they didn't ban me nor I did something wrong for them to get back at me.

There's this Pinetop patch where they have to replace an old existing map. Almost everyone playing the game made a thread not to replace the old map and even went as far as making a poll. Of course
recommended:
the people who are against the Pinetop patch won but the Devs still removed the map and from 16servers PvE they decreased it to 5servers!

You can still play the old map only if you PAY the game!

But I'm not going to pay for a game who rebranded twice (also called WarZ and Infestation) and scammed their own players promising that their veterans will have incentives in Aftermath. Also they don't listen to their playerbase when majority says NO.

So they abandoned WarZ
hoursPlayed:
Infestation and soon to be this game. There's a rumor around forums they're making another game called Shattered Skies so goodluck if anyone wants to buy/download this upcoming game. It'll be abandoned too and say goodbye to your money.

Glad I didn't waste a dime in this game.

If UNINSTALL has a price of $500 I'd happily buy it instead of playing the game!"

reviewText: This game. Where do I begin. Well the minute I loaded this game up I knew I just knew that it was a mess. So I tried looking in my settings to turn the resolution down to better fit my monitor but all there was is 180 and 720 not like I'm saying anything bad about that its just that it looks ♥♥♥♥♥♥ on a monitor like mine. My resolution is 1280x1024 and it looks horrendus on the game even at 1280x720. So I finally got into the actual game there was no inventory ui no menu ui all I got was a grey screen with my character behind it. I tab out on accounts that windows was asking ot verify the program so I clicked yes. I went back into the game only for it to crash and leave my desktop broken. This game had some potential but dont let the free gameplay of this peice of garbage fool you it is a broken buggy disgusting mess. 1/10

reviewText:
I went in to this game being aware of its past and origin, but having not played its predecessors they did not sway my judgement. After creating an account, briefly creating a character and selecting a server I readied myself for the apocalypse.

I spawned at the edge of barren desert town. I expected my journey to be lonely, hard and arduous; and so I ploughed on. I started by walking towards a large factory like building and caught the attention of three zombies. I needed to act, and fast. I needed a swarve and brilliant maneuverer, so I jumped on the roof of a car. This somehow stopped a group of ravenous, flesh hungry killers. I decided on my next plan action, I needed to make a break for it, so ran round a corner. This seemed to do the job. I moved across the street into a house and came across a firearm, a rifle of some sort, what luck I thought to myself; although to my dismay there was no ammunition. Never mind, a magazine would undoubtedly turn up somewhere as I looted the houses in this small village. I put the gun away and walked out into the rear garden, making a turn I started towards the next house. There I was, a freshly spawned, mostly unarmed survivor. All I had to my name was an empty water bottle, some bandages and an unusable rifle in my backpack.  A loud crack sounded behind me, a hole appeared in my head and I fell to the floor. My character had neither the adamantium nor healing powers of wolverine, so I was finished. Three armed assailants entered the garden, fondled my body and walked off. That was the story of my life…

All three minutes and  forty-three seconds of it.

10/10 The only aftermath I’ve experienced playing this game was the mess created after my bowels shot fecal matter everywhere.

reviewText:

- good hitboxes

CONS:

overall 7/10

reviewText:
Merciful. ♥♥♥♥ing. Christ.

This is literally The WarZ Infestation: Survival Stories 2. The most horrendous pile of ♥♥♥♥ing garbage I've ever played, by far.

Take DayZ, somehow give it WORSE optimization (>50fps with PS2 era graphics, on an i7 and a GTX 970, 16gigs of RAM), half the running speed of player characters, remove the physics engine, add a half-♥♥♥♥♥ base-building aspect, toss a cubic ♥♥♥♥ ton of ♥♥♥♥ing statues everywhere, and to top it all off add MOTHER♥♥♥♥ING MICRO-TRANSACTIONS.

CRATE DROPS WITH KEYS FOR WEAPON SKINS.

YOU HAVE GOT TO BE ♥♥♥♥ING KIDDING ME.

Too many games are taking this approach, on the coat-tails of DOTA, TF2, and CS:GO. I'm speaking to the developers when I say this, VALVE CAN GET AWAY WITH IT BECAUSE THEY MAKE FUN GAMES. Sweet christ you ♥♥♥♥ing idiots. Were there not enough zombie-apocalypse based survival crafting games on steam already? George Romero's name is ♥♥♥♥ing tarnished because of this horrible excuse of a game.

reviewText:
This is exactly like Infestation except for a few things that I felt was a bit improved on.
Anyone who has played Infestation knows the pain of actually finding things, I mean anything. You had to walk miles to find anything good. In this game however there's stuff literally everywhere, It's still a piece of ♥♥♥♥ game but I can finally find stuff, yay.

Also you have an infinite sprint stamina. You can actually outrun zombies if you need to or want to.
And killing the zombies isn't that difficult either cus I almost immediately found a weapon that does 100+ something in damage.

This game needs A LOT of work before it can get a thumbs up. But definitely play this game instead of Infestation survivor stories cus at least this one is free to play.

reviewText:
While I havent played it enough to recommend. I thought my first life would be enough to give what will possibly be your first life aswell..

After registering and agreeing to so many TOS's I got concerned I was selling my soul to satan I got into the game. PVP or PvE. I should pick PvE but whats a survival experience without pvp. so anyways I started off. A large backpack suprisingly. LV 4. Really? also a nice little knife, Looted local area got some beans and stuff, Looked at the map. Decently sized. No complaints. Saw a local train station with what I assumed was a gun symbol over it. Decided to leg it over there, Used some Bnocs I found to scout it out.

I knew I was going to run into a player here. but I didnt see any. Managed to fight two zombies to get in, Looted a little bit, Killed a zombie it dropped a weapons chest, Oh my lucky day, but it was one of those TF/CS crates that can only be oppened with your real life money. Meh, I didnt expect a gun so quickly anyways, also I probably wouldnt of gotten ammo. Searched further down and I heard this massive growl. Now what I can only assume was a freshly spawned horde comes in, naturally I leg it. There pathfinding was poor so when I got abit away while they were learning if you could walk over train tracks I decided to check my inventory again. What sounded like a shotgun blast in the earlobe scared the ♥♥♥♥ out of me and I look around. No-ones there. I get shot again, what the hell. I back into the corner with a lot of cover and knife some zombies who found me but didnt dare walk near my corner and simply let me stab them. Died of what I think was blood lose.

GG was only to assume this would happen on a pvp server. Second life. One flashlight and ♥♥♥♥ all else. why?

My last words on this is, This is another one of those Russian Survival Games" since zombies are too stupid to be a threat and the russian speaking bandits are everywhere and your probably in atleast one of their scopes at any given time. This isnt the games fault but im pretty sure we have all had less than pleasent experiences with russians in particular in survival games. Maybe they're too good or just more prone to agressiveness. Who knows?

I might change this to positive or atleast add more details as I put more hours in. but thats only if."

reviewText: Despite the bad reviews, I decided to give this game a go because I love zombie games and it couldn't be THAT bad. After discovering the global inventory storage, I decided it was progress. I got my goodies after a new game, went to an infested city, put some fuel in one of the generators, and I'm on my way to another town when my game suddenly disconnects. GREAT. The game reloads, and I die, and all the things I've worked so hard to keep WAS GONE. FFS. I was willing to let the lack of leveling system go, or the stupid zombies that NEVER DIE, but to get disconnected and die for a reason that's not MY FAULT is just stupid. The joke is obviously on ME. DON'T PLAY.

reviewText:
I am a veteran player from I:SS (Still called WarZ by most players). After playing about 20 hours, I decided to stop playing after once again running into the problem which has taken I:SS to its grave. Hackers. When originally starting this game, I decided that if I encountered more than 1 hacker, i'd quit straight away. This didn't take long, with several players no-clipping through buildings to kill me and my friends.
Some other problems I got frustrated with included:
- Pay to Win aspect through 'Stash Chests'
- The overwhelming frequency of 'Case Drops'
- The poor rewards from city liberation
- Terrain and collision model errors (causing bullets to hit invisible walls midair)
- Low variety of weapons and ammo types
- Lack of cars/trucks (not once did I encounter any of these)
- Unusual craftables, with somethings being craftable that shouldn't be, and vice versa
- Extremely low performance

However to credit the developers, they did do some things pretty well:
- Range of materials to disassemble (this was a nice touch, but for the size of the map, this needed to be expanded more)
- Bandit system enforcing banditry as a risk
- Uncommon ammo, as you'd expect in a zombie apocalypse
- Good town/location distribution (walking was not as frustrating as in I:SS or other similar games)
- Powerful melee weapons (this really helped even the gap between new players and ones who were already geared)

Overall, the game feels like an alpha version, unfinished and unpolished. Given time and a good development team, it could have turned into a wonderful game. History says that this won't happen with Aftermath though, and I don't expect it to.

Method Related Recipes Notes
Step 1
Preheat the oven to 160C. Grease and line a 24cm round springform cake pan.
Step 2
Sift the flour, cocoa, baking powder and bicarbonate of soda into a bowl. Set aside.
Step 3
Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water (don't let bowl touch water). Cool slightly.
Step 4
Beat butter and sugar with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. With beaters on medium speed, add vanilla, then add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Pour in cooled chocolate and beat until well combined. Beat in a third of sifted ingredients, followed by a third of the milk. Repeat until all ingredients are incorporated, beating until smooth.
Step 5
Pour mixture into the pan and bake for 45-55 minutes until risen and a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes, then invert onto rack to cool completely.
Step 6
To serve, spread the icing over the top and sides of the cake using a hot palette knife, then decorate with chocolate curls.
Step 7
To make chocolate ganache: Melt 150g chopped good-quality dark chocolate with 125ml pure cream and 20g unsalted butter in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water (don't let the bowl touch the water). Stir until well combined, then set aside for 30 minutes to cool and thicken before use.
Step 8
To make chocolate curls: Using a palette knife, spread melted chocolate 2-3mm thick on a hard clean surface such as a glass chopping board or marble slab that you can move. Stand at room temperature until almost set. Shave curls using a peeler or palette knife, pulling towards you at an angle. If the chocolate breaks, it is set too hard - leave in a warm place until more pliable. To make small curls, simply run a peeler along the side of a block of chocolate.

reviewText:
My Review for Romero's Aftermath..
Well.. this game didn't *totally* suck!

When I saw the game on the Steam store, I immediately went Oh dang
recommended: then I read some of the reviews, myself. After seeing mixed reviews, I decided to install the game. As I got in the game, it prompted a screen that required a login. After creating my account, it took me to the main menu. And like most games, it takes my system specs, and makes the game playable (somewhat.) A few minutes, post-gameplay, I noticed a couple issues. The combat just doesn't work well with this game, to be honest. The developers just didn't really take their time developing this Free-To-Play title. I honestly thought this game could've had some potential, but I guess the reviews were right. Don't waste your time installing this Free-To-Uninstall title, you'll find yourself regretting it.

reviewText:
For the first 10 hours I REALLY enjoyed this game. Learning it was pretty easy, fairly standard for a survival game. The looting felt epic and exciting, the loot tables seemed to be well balanced too - after the 10 hours I thought I had a pretty good horde of items. Then I decided to buy a few of those boxes from the store.... this is where the game really let me down, I realized that all those hours of looting were wasted. I have enough high end ammo and guns in my global inventory to last me a month of YOLO. I will never have to do loot runs again. Basically if you have $10 in your steam wallet the value of items in game will be worthless.

Sad to say that this game is P2W :(

If it switched to just cosmetic items I would deffinitly return to playing, but for now this gets a thumbs down. I will be monitoring the update logs in the hope that the devs listen to the feedback.

Absolute crap. Played around 6 hours on this to try if this really was crap and OH BOY it is. Don't waste your time on this, go play someting better.

reviewText:
Gather and survive game.  It is reasonably simple to figure out what is needed and how trading works.  The artwork and graphics are very very basic.  The story is non-existant.  All you do is run around liberate towns from infestation on some servers, on others you also kill other players for resources.

After zombie games like dead island and resident evil, the artwork in this game is very disappointing.  Controls scheme is very simple to grasp.  However, how the character responds to controls is a whole different story.

Due to very basic artwork, any upclose encoutner with a zombie would be full of surprises.  I could not gauge how close I could be to a zombie without getting hit.  The weapons would sometime hit the target from one distance and then from the other.  But this was something I could probably have lived with.

However, the blue screen of death errors caused by this game was what completely turned me away from it.  First day playing it I get an IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL" error.  My system is midgrade so I checked to see if recently updated graphics driver was causing the error with windows 10.  To my surprise in the system event log there is no error recorded prior to shutdown.  Next day I get a shutdown with "VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE (igdkm64.sys).  Now mind you I am running dual GPU system with onboard Intel Graphics used for non-gaming purposes.  I do however ensure each time to set the Nvidia GPU as the processor to be used for all the games.  So
date: how the hell do I get an error on the onboard chip if it shouldn't even be utilized at the time I am in the game??  To top all of it off
recommended: I go back into the system error log and again there is nothing recorded prior to the forced shutdown.\n\nI've run nearly a dozen games on this machine with a lot higher demands for harwdware than this game.  Not one caused a full system shutdown.  At worse
hoursPlayed: my Nvidia would be shutdown while playing Sniper Elite V2.  Why in the world would this game with such low requirements cause blue screen errors???\n\nThere is no way I will continue beating up my system for a game that is at best mediocre.  I am surprise a game riddled with this many errors is even on Steam."

reviewText:
Gather and survive game.  It is reasonably simple to figure out what is needed and how trading works.  The artwork and graphics are very very basic.  The story is non-existant.  All you do is run around liberate towns from infestation on some servers, on others you also kill other players for resources.

After zombie games like dead island and resident evil, the artwork in this game is very disappointing.  Controls scheme is very simple to grasp.  However, how the character responds to controls is a whole different story.

Due to very basic artwork, any upclose encoutner with a zombie would be full of surprises.  I could not gauge how close I could be to a zombie without getting hit.  The weapons would sometime hit the target from one distance and then from the other.  But this was something I could probably have lived with.

However, the blue screen of death errors caused by this game was what completely turned me away from it.  First day playing it I get an IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL" error.  My system is midgrade so I checked to see if recently updated graphics driver was causing the error with windows 10.  To my surprise in the system event log there is no error recorded prior to shutdown.  Next day I get a shutdown with "VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE (igdkm64.sys).  Now mind you I am running dual GPU system with onboard Intel Graphics used for non-gaming purposes.  I do however ensure each time to set the Nvidia GPU as the processor to be used for all the games.  So
date: how the hell do I get an error on the onboard chip if it shouldn't even be utilized at the time I am in the game??  To top all of it off
recommended: I go back into the system error log and again there is nothing recorded prior to the forced shutdown.\n\nI've run nearly a dozen games on this machine with a lot higher demands for harwdware than this game.  Not one caused a full system shutdown.  At worse
hoursPlayed: my Nvidia would be shutdown while playing Sniper Elite V2.  Why in the world would this game with such low requirements cause blue screen errors???\n\nThere is no way I will continue beating up my system for a game that is at best mediocre.  I am surprise a game riddled with this many errors is even on Steam."

reviewText:
My Review for Romero's Aftermath..
Well.. this game didn't *totally* suck!

When I saw the game on the Steam store, I immediately went Oh dang
recommended: then I read some of the reviews, myself. After seeing mixed reviews, I decided to install the game. As I got in the game, it prompted a screen that required a login. After creating my account, it took me to the main menu. And like most games, it takes my system specs, and makes the game playable (somewhat.) A few minutes, post-gameplay, I noticed a couple issues. The combat just doesn't work well with this game, to be honest. The developers just didn't really take their time developing this Free-To-Play title. I honestly thought this game could've had some potential, but I guess the reviews were right. Don't waste your time installing this Free-To-Uninstall title, you'll find yourself regretting it.

reviewText:
I am going to try to give a detailed account of my experience.
I am playing with:

AMD Radeon 7200 HD
8GB RAM
i5 Intel Processor

I have this game set at medium graphics.

A lot of people have been down voting this game but if you notice they only throw in about an hour of gameplay and then go make a review...
Although this game has some issues it is very playable.
I recorded how long it takes to load a server. I did this 3 times and its about 2 minute load time.
The graphics are ok, they could be better.
I've only crashed twice since playing this game.
A lot of people have been complaining about the sprint option not draining stanima....well yeah, when your only real means of getting around is by foot, jogging kind of takes too long. Even when you are sprinting it takes awhile to get where you are going.
which brings me to another point: The zombies are dumb. You can out run them, you can find a car or rock to stand on and kill them without taking any damage, they are alittle rough when it comes to chasing you. They are easy to kill as well.

A few things I hated to see. I could find guns and weapons but you cant sell them. I can buy binocolers for 850 but the sell price is 50? It will take awhile to buy anything good.

Another thing I would like to see changed is music...there is no music or ambient sounds. I know that seems small but it makes a difference for me atleast.

Other than that, I get a good 80 FPS out of towns and cities and I get roughly 50 FPS in cities.

I like the game, I think its fun, I havent tested any of the building features yet but it seems cool, I think having to find blueprints is a good challenege although others will diagree.

I rate this game 8/10

reviewText: I can only speak for the pve portion of this game, as I'm not really into the pvp stuff. But as far as pve is concerned this is a good game.  Made great if you also enjoy the social aspect of gaming.  If not, this game isnt for you. The pve community has always been cool and open to helping out new players, far more so than 99% of other games I've played. But that doesnt mean you can just hop in the game and start telling people to give you stuff and they'll do it. You wont have fun or get much of any help at all going into it like that. If you come into the game not begging for stuff immediately or try attacking everyone you see (it's pve you cant hurt anyone, you just look stupid) for no reason, you'll find that there's more to this game. I can honestly say I've met some of the best people to enjoy gaming with online here. And still having a lot of fun with it\n\nThe only negative i would have to say is the dev could really be more open the happenings to the community. For example waiting for this next map update. Telling your earliest supporters of the game that its coming when it's reasdy" isnt a way to keep their support. Especially after having them remove all the things they've put their time into building.Nothing good comes from  them siting wonder when they can use what is a huge portion of pve again. I know several people who have just moved on
date: that most likely would have stayed had some effort of communication even just a reasonable time frame been given to them. These are the people that will build your game
recommended: I'm not sure the dev is doing much in building that relationship unfortuntaely. Putting some type of public relations would do wonders for this dev ."

reviewText: I liked this game. It has some negative sides like long distance runnings because bagpacks are hard to find (thanks for autorunning btw :p ) and buggy zombies :D . Other thing is no singleplayer mode :/ . My internet sucks so multiplayer servers are laggy to me D: . thats why I have to wait for singleplayer mode :/ . Few more negative sides are 1. you dont know the sell value for your items. ( I thought my shotgun is worth more than my pistol <.< . so I took shotgun with me from town.... I could not even sell it D: . pistol was worth more.. ) 2. This is not so negative side. Xp and skills would be nice addon :D . Then the positive ones :) . 1. This game is challenging 2. Autorun :D . you can just set your way and press autorun key.. it runs there :D 3. Epic stamina for running 4. Graphics 5. Zombies :3 . cute and smart and unique ones :D . 6. Safe zones. (I wish they were closer to towns and cities <.< . ) So. I say. Good game :)  . not much to make it even better :D . oh.. 7. This is free game :D! 8. ofcourse.. crafting :)  . so nicely done one :D . damn this is long text D: and messy <.< . But ya. Thumbs up for ya :D!

reviewText:
This is like a F2P softcore version of DayZ.

The big difference is there is PvE servers along with a global bank that saves items after death.
Other than that, this is pretty much the same thing.

If you're interested in Zombie Survival games for either the loot, crafting or PvP, give this game a go.


For those of you complaining about crashes, well - I haven't seen any as of yet. And I've played 50 hours. On two systems.

reviewText: From the makers of that game you loved, the WarZ, comes WarZ 2.0.  Or maybe closer to 1.2.  The majority of resources appear to have been ripped from WarZ (yes, it's infestation" now)
date: just like they did with WarInc before that.  Zombies are still the ridiculous-looking creatures that run with their arms at their sides and use the same (bad) animations from the previous game.  In fact
recommended: all the animations are simply dreadful.  I would expect this from a game over a decade ago or a team just starting out
hoursPlayed: but but the only conclusion at this point is that they're simply incompetent or don't care.\n\nSounds and animations are no better than previously
voteText: with a lot of sounds being completely inaccurate to the source.  For example
helpfulPercent:
punching a glass door sounds like a gunshot.  Attack animations don't match up to the hit detection in the least and you'll very often have no idea why you took damage or why you actually hit/missed the zombie with your attack.  Trees "blow" in the wind with a motion as if they're one of those novelty robotic dancing flowers.

Items still float over a lot of surfaces (yet another thing they never got working in the last game).

Textures are laughable and
votesHelpful: while I don't care about graphics in a game as long as it's fun
votesTotal: seeing visible 'seams' from where things are stacked on top of each other is just stupid.  Some things
commentsCount: still sit halfway into the ground or whatever object they're supposed to be on top of.\n\nIt's still one giant walking simulator
column16: with it taking me well over 15 minutes to run from one area of any note to the next and the actual 'survival' aspect is still almost nil
column17: since items (food and water even) are plentiful if you head to any noteworthy location.\n\nThere appear to be plenty of craftable items
column18: which can be a plus.  Variety of items is actually something I kind of liked in the previous game.  PVE servers can be fun for a while
column19: if you're the exploring/looting kind of person
column20: as I am.\n\nI'm willing to call it an improvement to the WarZ
column21: but not in any real way that makes it a much better game.   The biggest plus I've found is that they didn't con money out of anyone because there's no (required) cost to play."

reviewText: I would wholeheartedly recommend this game to people who would like to have a decently challenging survival experiance in a zombie apocalypse. This game allows for a player to go out, forage for their own food and water, then attempt to build up their life and home. Granted, there are a few bugs, but this game is all-in-all amazing, when you consider that it is a Free-to-Play game. The map size is colossal, the Crafting is decently simple, the main issue that I have with this game are a few wonky controls, which one can simply adapt to as they play.
